simple.label: Simple Question
simple.value: Create a simple high school physics question about [...].

illustrated.label: Illustrated Question
illustrated.value: Create a high school physics question about [...] that includes diagrams, free-body sketches, or circuit drawings to support the problem.

examModel.label: Exam-Style Question
examModel.value: Create a practice physics question in the style of [IB/AP/OSN] exams for high school level on the topic of [...]. Use language and structure similar to actual exam questions. Include answer choices (if applicable) and detailed explanations.

hots.label: HOTS Question
hots.value: Create a high school physics question that requires higher-order thinking skills (HOTS), such as analysis, synthesis, or evaluation, on the topic of [...]. Include the question, answer, and an explanation of why it qualifies as a HOTS question.

shortAnswer.label: Short Answer Question
shortAnswer.value: Create a short-answer physics question for high school students about [...]. The response should be a physical quantity with correct units. Include the answer key and step-by-step solution.

story.label: Word Problem
story.value: Create a contextual word problem for high school physics related to real-life situations, focusing on [...]. Provide the complete answer with detailed explanation.

quadratic.label: Kinematics Graph Question
quadratic.value: Create a question about one-dimensional motion that covers interpreting position-time or velocity-time graphs, determining acceleration, and connecting motion equations to real phenomena.

limit.label: Electric Circuit Problem
limit.value: Develop a question involving series-parallel circuits, Ohm's law, and power calculations. Include the reasoning required to simplify the circuit and compute requested quantities.

derivative.label: Force and Motion Analysis
derivative.value: Create a multi-step problem that applies Newton's laws to analyze forces, free-body diagrams, and resulting accelerations. Include explanations and solution steps.

integral.label: Work and Energy Question
integral.value: Design a question that connects work, kinetic energy, potential energy, and energy conservation in practical situations. Include thorough calculation steps.

statistics.label: Wave and Oscillation Question
statistics.value: Create a question related to simple harmonic motion or wave phenomena, such as determining period, phase, wavelength, or resonance behavior using real-world data.

algebra.label: Classical Mechanics
algebra.value: Create questions that test students' understanding of kinematics, dynamics, momentum, and impulse.

trigonometry.label: Optics and Light
trigonometry.value: Create questions that train students to analyze reflection, refraction, lens systems, or wave interference patterns.

calculus.label: Electricity and Magnetism
calculus.value: Design questions covering electric fields, circuits, magnetic forces, or electromagnetic induction.

geometry.label: Modern Physics
geometry.value: Create questions that explore relativity, quantum concepts, or atomic structure for high school learners.

probability.label: Thermodynamics and Heat
probability.value: Create questions about heat transfer, gas laws, entropy, or thermal efficiency in daily-life contexts.

numberTheory.label: Fluid Mechanics
numberTheory.value: Design questions involving pressure, buoyancy, continuity, or Bernoulli's principle.

linearAlgebra.label: Nuclear and Particle Physics
linearAlgebra.value: Create questions that test understanding of radioactivity, nuclear reactions, or particle interactions.

discreteMath.label: Astronomy and Space Science
discreteMath.value: Develop questions about planetary motion, satellites, or observational astronomy phenomena.

mathLogic.label: Measurement and Instrumentation
mathLogic.value: Create questions assessing understanding of measurement uncertainty, significant figures, and laboratory instrumentation.

login.title: Teacher Login
login.nuptkPlaceholder: Unique Number for Educators and Education Personnel

main.title: Auto Physics
main.subtitle: AI-powered automatic physics question generation for high school level
main.commandPlaceholder: Enter your instruction to generate questions
main.question: Question

streaming.failedToStartStreaming: Failed to start streaming for chunk {{chunkIndex}}
